alert.note: Alert for Clackamas (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 6:13AM PST until December 20 at 4:05PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following counties, Clackamas, Marion, Polk and Yamhill. * WHEN...Until noon PST. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 606 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing small streams and poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salem, Keizer, McMinnville, Oregon City, Dallas, Sheridan, West Linn, Wilsonville, Canby, Silverton, Molalla, Estacada, Dayton and Amity. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
